title: Get Started
text: example uses three xlsx files located “example_data” folder package. preliminary step necessary working data, access files bundled package, need run line.
code: # set up to read the package files. You will not need to do this to read your own data. path_to_example_files <- system.file("example_data", package="SPCreporter")

title: Get Started
code: # read in measure data from the three worksheets in the example file measure_data <- list(   week = readxl::read_xlsx(file.path(path_to_example_files, "data.xlsx"), sheet = "week"), # weekly data   month = readxl::read_xlsx(file.path(path_to_example_files, "data.xlsx"), sheet = "month"), # monthly data   none = readxl::read_xlsx(file.path(path_to_example_files, "data.xlsx"), sheet = "none") # pre-calculated time-between rare events data )  # read in the report config from example file report_config <- readxl::read_xlsx(file.path(path_to_example_files, "report_config.xlsx"))  # read in measure config from example file measure_config <- readxl::read_xlsx(file.path(path_to_example_files, "measure_config.xlsx"))

title: Get Started
code: # create the data bundle data_bundle <- spcr_make_data_bundle(   measure_data = measure_data,    report_config = report_config,   measure_config = measure_config,   data_cutoff_dttm = as.POSIXct("2022-09-30 23:59:59") )

title: Get Started
text: Success! rendered report look like example report. run example, might choose move three example config files machine, replicate process . , start modifying files reflect data reporting needs…
code: # make the report, including information for the six mandatory arguments. spcr_make_report(   data_bundle = data_bundle,   report_title = "My Example Report",   report_ref = "EG.001",   author_name = "Anne Author",   author_email = "a.author@example.com" )

title: Authors and Citation

what: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style
title: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style
text: {SPCreporter} simple way add value performance reporting using statistical process control. produces reports similar example report. Help sort signals noise, ensure leadership talking signals matter. layout method heavily inspired NHS England & Improvement “Making Data Count” programme, encourages use SPC time-series charts replace “red, amber, green” threshold performance reporting. SPC calculations made using {NHSRplotthedots} package, NHS-R Community. link 2022 NHS-R Conference talk, presented overview package:

title: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style
text: can install development version SPCreporter GitHub :

title: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style
text: Two main functions used make report. first creates “data bundle” contains metric-level information needed report. second takes bundle raw input, converts html report.
code: library(SPCreporter)  # create a data_bundle, using 3 arguments data_bundle <- spcr_make_data_bundle(   measure_data, # your data to plot   report_config, # config for the report (section titles, etc)   measure_config  # config for the measures (details required by SPC) )  # pass the bundle into the make_report function spcr_make_report(   data_bundle = data_bundle,   ... # various report arguments - see full docs for details )

what: See the vignettes for additional examples:
title: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style
text: Get Started vignette - Start produce first report using data bundled package. Creating multiple reports - example use {purrr} automate groups reports.

what: SPCreporter: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style — SPCreporter-package
title: SPCreporter: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style — SPCreporter-package
text: Takes dataset file configuration file produce HTML report metric presented SPC chart. initial rendering report contains charts folded enable quick scanning "variation" "assurance" status. metric can unfolded reveal SPC chart support clinical management planning. NHSRplotthedots package used SPC calculations, "variation" "assurance" line popular standard within UK's National Health Service (NHS).

title: SPCreporter: Creates Metric Reports using Statistical Process Control in the NHS style — SPCreporter-package
text: Maintainer: Tom Smith tomsmith_uk@hotmail.com Authors: Fran Barton fbarton@alwaysdata.net

title: Make a bundle of data — spcr_make_data_bundle
code: spcr_make_data_bundle(   measure_data = test_measure_data,   report_config = test_report_config,   measure_config = test_measure_config,   data_cutoff_dttm = Sys.time() )

title: Make a bundle of data — spcr_make_data_bundle
text: measure_data list. List containing data frames data wide format report_config data frame. Config information report measure_config data frame. Config information measures data_cutoff_dttm POSIXct. data cutoff date-time (last date-time data report eg. month-end)

title: Make a bundle of data — spcr_make_data_bundle
text: data frame. nested data frame containing source data report

title: Make the SPC Report — spcr_make_report
text: Make SPC Report

title: Make the SPC Report — spcr_make_report
code: spcr_make_report(   data_bundle,   report_title = "SPC Report",   subtitle = NULL,   document_title = NULL,   report_ref = "",   logo_path = "nhs",   department = NULL,   department_text_colour = "black",   intro = NULL,   author_name = "Anne Author",   author_email = "a.author@example.com",   paper_colour = "white",   accordion_colour = "#CCF2FF",   stale_colour = "#FFD1AD",   fresh_colour = "white",   output_directory = ".",   output_type = c("html", "csv"),   include_dq_icon = TRUE,   annotate_limits = TRUE )

title: Make the SPC Report — spcr_make_report
text: data_bundle data frame. pre-processed bundle information (ideally made spcr_make_data_bundle()) report_title string. report title, printed top report subtitle string. report subtitle, printed top report document_title string. title document, used HTML <title> tag PDF document title. left NULL (default), function use report_title parameter current date construct title report_ref string. unique reference report logo_path string. File path logo used report department string. text suffix positioned underneath logo, eg. department name department_text_colour string. colour department text intro string. Intro text printed head report author_name string. author's name author_email string. author's contact email address paper_colour string. Customise background colour using hex code, CSS colour name accordion_colour string. Customise accordion colour using hex code, CSS colour name stale_colour string. Customise date lozenge indicate data stale, using hex code, CSS colour name fresh_colour string. Customise date lozenge indicate data date, using hex code, CSS colour name output_directory string. name directory save resulting report output_type vector. Specify output types needed.  Default c("html", "csv"). "pdf" also possible. include_dq_icon logical. Whether include data quality icon final report annotate_limits logical. Whether add annotations secondary y axis process limits mean

title: SPCreporter 0.2.0
text: BREAKING CHANGE - Added ability create rare-event charts type “T” (time-). report now mobile friendly, works narrow screens. breakpoint wide narrow layout 768px. ability add commentary added previously, now method demonstrated example config docs. Added explanation data-quality icons footer report. Added ability output “.pdf” reports, include tidy page-breaks.

title: SPCreporter 0.2.0
text: Added optional columns example excel config documents, aid onboarding new users. BREAKING CHANGE - argument export_csv spcr_make_report() disused replaced output_type now vector required output types. Current valid options “html”, “pdf”, “csv”. method allow addition report types future. File size reduced approx 30% handling plot resolution differently, 0.6MB removing javascript, css, font files bundled part RMarkdown. result latter change template behaves less like standard Rmd reliant custom CSS, rarely edited file size reduction worth trade-.

title: SPCreporter 0.2.0
text: spaces report name now replaced underscores. Previously first space replaced. CSV output now respects output_directory argument. Previously file saved working directory regardless output_directory argument.

title: SPCreporter 0.2.0
text: Associated addition rare-event charts: * report_config now includes mandatory column spc_chart_type. Valid values column “xmr” “t”. * measure_data now includes mandatory list item (excel worksheet) called “events”. * data_cutoff_dttm argument moved spcr_make_report() spcr_make_data_bundle() support calculation final plotted point, placed illustrate happen event happen date. Associated addition pdf csv output types: * argument export_csv spcr_make_report() disused replaced output_type.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.6
text: new argument “annotate_limits” available spcr_make_report(). default TRUE, adds labels numeric values control limits mean right plot.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.6
text: Fixed bug caused status messages printed main report report generation done slow computer. Fixed minor README argument name mistake, thrown error new users.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: version introduces large number changes package. additional tests written, existing tests amended match latest versions functions.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: align_rebase_dates() function now ensures rebase dates matching data point still observed included charts. achieved moving rebase date nearest data point following rebase date. fix issue #35.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: data bundle creation process now uses streamlined pipeline. aims make various data preparation steps easier follow debug. data bundle generated spcr_make_data_bundle() less comprehensive previous versions, omitting SPC chart data focusing providing human-readable source data spcr_make_report().

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: SPC data parcel creation SPC chart creation now handled within spcr_make_report() rather part data bundle. Chart generation report now based around RMarkdown partial template (inst/Rmd/details_template.Rmd) mapped code within main RMarkdown report template. replaces {htmltools} approach used previous versions. Chart PNGs now created temp files converted URI strings using knitr::image_uri(). injected HTML code directly, instead using hyperlinks PNG files. report now gets custom title (can set document_title field) used <title> tag HTML output. shown document title browser tab. export_csv argument spcr_make_report now allows easy creation CSV file source data report, timestamp HTML file. addresses issue #17. report longer auto-opens browser, plays beep, creation process complete. behaviour easily restored desired.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: main user-facing functions now spcr_ prefix. package functions collected two files, checking_functions helper_functions. Several functions removed, replaced made obsolete steps new bundle generation process.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5.6
text: Example data already supplied package (xlsx files inst folder) now also available internal package data, can used example data demonstrating package functions also facilitating testing.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5
text: Rebasing SPC charts now supported. Pass date string “YYYY-MM-DD” format, multiple date strings. '"2020-01-01"', '"2020-01-01", "2021-05-01"' Stale data now highlighted report. default data highlighted stale report cutoff data update date (defined updated_to argument data, data_cutoff_dttm report). Optionally, column called allowable_days_lag can included measure_config. can used delay flagging stale data. example using value 31 allowable_days_lag column enable measure reported month arrears without flagged stale.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5
text: Fixes issue mismatches measure_name across 3 supplied dataframes (measure_data, report_config, measure_config) error message throw reported missing data. Error: spcr_check_dataset_is_complete: Data missing 1 report items. first ref 1, M1, monthly. correct helpful error case complain name mismatch: Error: spcr_check_measure_names: name mismatch measure ref: 1. Check typos mismatching refs data. Improved progress messages spcr_make_data_bundle() support debugging incoming data.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.5
text: Fix bug relating NAs dataset causing printed warnings final report, well blank space charts. new behaviour strips NAs data, meaning chart axis starts first data point, ends last.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.4
text: Add two new optional columns measure_config: “Reviewed ”, “Escalated ”. present text fields rendered final report chart.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.4
text: Fixed error caused measure_data contained NAs. package now tolerate NAs data.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.3
text: Significant improvements error messages relating measure_data, report_config, measure_config. Error messages now explicitly name required columns user supplied. intended make troubleshooting simpler . data source metrics now named charts caption. minor useability improvements intended make working real-world config documents easier .

title: SPCreporter 0.1.2
text: measure_data requires data one () “week” “month”. measure_data tolerates capitalised list (worksheet) names. Use base pipe |> place %>%. Throw helpful error insufficient data items provided given report.

title: SPCreporter 0.1.1
text: Fixes error occurring targets set reported measures

title: SPCreporter 0.1.0
text: spcr_make_data_bundle() spcr_make_report()
